bug.author: opencv-pushbot
bug.summary: Native camera does not work with Android 4.3 on Samsung Note III SM-N9005
bug.description:
Transferred from http://code.opencv.org/issues/3347 || Christophe E on 2013-10-25 15:13 || Priority: Low || Affected: branch '2.4' (2.4-dev) || Category: android || Tracker: Bug || Difficulty: || PR: https://github.com/Itseez/opencv/pull/2501 || Platform: ARM / Android Native camera does not work with Android 4.3 on Samsung Note III SM-N9005 Can not access to the camera from native code using opencv cv::VideoCapture() on a Samsung Note III SM-N9005 under Android 4.3. Apparently the camera wrapper failed to connect to the libraries. The opencv's version used is : 2.4.7 build with the following configuration : cmake.exe -G"MinGW Makefiles" -DCMAKE_TOOLCHAIN_FILE=..\android\android.toolchain.cmake -DANDROID_TOOLCHAIN_NAME="arm-linux-androideabi-4.8" -DCMAKE_MAKE_PROGRAM=%MAKE_EXE% -DBUILD_SHARED_LIBS=OFF -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RELEASE -DBUILD_TESTS=OFF -DBUILD_PERF_TESTS=OFF -DBUILD_WITH_DEBUG_INFO=OFF -DANDROID_ABI="armeabi-v7a with NEON" -DENABLE_NEON=ON -DWITH_TBB=ON -DBUILD_TBB=ON -DCMAKE_VERBOSE_MAKEFILE=OFF ..\.. cmake.exe --build . make install The same code successfully run on a Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1 SHW-M480W under Android 4.1.2 History Dmitry Retinskiy on 2013-10-28 18:44 Hi Alexander, could you check this problem and say your opinion? Thanks. - Target version set to 2.4.8 - Assignee set to Alexander Smorkalov Alexander Smorkalov on 2013-10-30 06:05 Thank you for bug report. Could you, please, provide application initialization log (logcat). I need to determine error code, error message and analyze camera initialization process. - Status changed from New to Open Christophe E on 2013-10-30 13:39 Hi, Here are the information you asked for. The log has no filter applied on it so it's a bit messy. Chris - File log.txt added Christophe E on 2013-10-30 13:41 - File log.txt added - File log_samsung_note3_android_4.3.txt added - File log_samsung_note10.1_android_4.1.2.txt added Alexander Smorkalov on 2013-10-31 08:21 - Operating System changed from Windows to Android - Category set to android Alexander Smorkalov on 2013-10-31 08:57 -Thank you for logs, I've started to work on the issue. You log for Android 4.3 is not full. I need some information about previous steps. Could you, please, do not cat log or send me all from this point- I found everything in other log files. Thank you. Alexander Smorkalov on 2013-10-31 09:46 
10-30 14:31:50.591: D/OpenCV::camera(1026): Libraries folder found: /data/app-lib/com.example.sdkdemo-1/
10-30 14:31:50.591: D/OpenCV::camera(1026): CameraWrapperConnector::connectToLib: folderPath=/data/app-lib/com.example.sdkdemo-1/
10-30 14:31:50.591: E/OpenCV::camera(1026): CameraWrapperConnector::connectToLib ERROR: cannot dlopen camera wrapper library
10-30 14:31:50.591: E/OpenCV::camera(1026): Native_camera returned opening error: 4
This lines in your log mean, that you do not use OpenCV Manager and libnative_camera_xxx.so are missing from your apk package. APK file is just a zip archive. Extract it and check libnative_camera_xxx.so libs. I close the ticket. Fill free to reopen it in case of other problems. - Status changed from Open to Cancelled Christophe E on 2013-11-01 13:24 Indeed i don't use OpenCV Manager. I use the OpenCV.mk with the following definition within my Android.mk : 
include $(CLEAR_VARS)
OPENCV_CAMERA_MODULES:=on
OPENCV_INSTALL_MODULES:=on
include /OpenCV.mk
Apparently doing this, libnative_camera_xxx.so are not copied to the "libs" folder and therefore are not in the .apk package. Now if I manually add them to my "libs" folder and build the application, I get the following log when application is launched. 
11-01 14:21:56.691: I/System.out(6574): Sending WAIT chunk
11-01 14:21:56.691: W/ActivityThread(6574): Application com.example.sdkdemo is waiting for the debugger on port 8100...

11-01 14:21:59.221: D/dalvikvm(6574): Trying to load lib /data/app-lib/com.example.sdkdemo-1/libfreeimage-3.14.so 0x4295a480

11-01 14:21:59.221: D/dalvikvm(6574): No JNI_OnLoad found in /data/app-lib/com.example.sdkdemo-1/libfreeimage-3.14.so 0x4295a480, skipping init
11-01 14:21:59.231: D/dalvikvm(6574): Trying to load lib /data/app-lib/com.example.sdkdemo-1/libopencv_java.so 0x4295a480
11-01 14:21:59.251: D/dalvikvm(6574): Added shared lib /data/app-lib/com.example.sdkdemo-1/libopencv_java.so 0x4295a480
11-01 14:21:59.251: D/dalvikvm(6574): Trying to load lib /data/app-lib/com.example.sdkdemo-1/libNativeVideoCapture-1.0.so 0x4295a480
11-01 14:21:59.251: E/dalvikvm(6574): dlopen("/data/app-lib/com.example.sdkdemo-1/libNativeVideoCapture-1.0.so") failed: dlopen failed: could not load library "libnative_camera_r2.2.0.so" needed by "libNativeVideoCapture-1.0.so"; caused by cannot locate symbol "_ZN7android6Camera10disconnectEv" referenced by "libnative_camera_r2.2.0.so"...
11-01 14:21:59.261: E/Libs(6574): Unable to load libs : java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: dlopen failed: could not load library "libnative_camera_r2.2.0.so" needed by "libNativeVideoCapture-1.0.so"; caused by cannot locate symbol "_ZN7android6Camera10disconnectEv" referenced by "libnative_camera_r2.2.0.so"...
- Status changed from Cancelled to Incomplete Christophe E on 2013-11-04 09:39 - Status changed from Incomplete to Open Alexander Smorkalov on 2013-11-05 08:43 1. What is libNativeVideoCapture-1.0.so? cv::VideoCapture implementation tries to load libnative_camera_xxx one by one and find the most appropriate. It looks like you try to use libnative_camera_xxx directly without cv::VideoCapture. In this case you need to do the same procedure. It is implemented in modules/androidcamera/src/camera_activity.cpp. 2. I'll try to reproduce the issue with coping of camera libs. Christophe E on 2013-11-05 09:21 Basically what is done in libNativeVideoCapture.so is : 
cv::VideoCapture cap = cv::VideoCapture();
cap.open(CV_CAP_ANDROID_FRONT);
if(cap.isOpened())
{
    cap.set(CV_CAP_PROP_FRAME_WIDTH,aWidth);
    cap.set(CV_CAP_PROP_FRAME_HEIGHT,aHeight);
}

//Do some other stuff (initialize other parts)
// ...

if(cap.isOpened() == true && cap.grab() == true)
{
    //With cv::Mat aFrame define elsewhere
    cap.retrieve(aFrame),CV_CAP_ANDROID_COLOR_FRAME_RGBA);
}
Christophe E on 2013-11-11 14:10 I forget to tell you that in fact I have copied all the libnative_camera_xxx into my libs folder. Is this the correct way to do it or should I only include the one that I am interested in ? Alexander Smorkalov on 2013-11-17 18:40 If you include OpenCV.mk and set OPENCV_CAMERA_MODULES:=on the makefile must copy libnative_camera_xxx automatically. It is made to prevent from auto clean lib folder by Android make system. It looks then this automation step was broken in one of the last releases. I close the issue and open new one about Android.mk. Alexander Smorkalov on 2013-11-17 18:43 New issue #3383 about OPENCV_CAMERA_MODULES:=on was created. - Status changed from Open to Cancelled Alexander Smorkalov on 2013-11-18 06:56 I cannot reproduce your problem with native camera libs and Android.mk. Please add your Android.mk file to issue #3383. Christophe E on 2013-11-22 10:31 The reason you can not reproduce the case is because I have made a mistake. I basically add the libnative_camera_xxx in LOCAL_SHARED_LIBRARIES which is actually wrong. And yes I also noted that the flag OPENCV_CAMERA_MODULES:=ON has no effect on the OpenCV.mk. Now if if manually copy the libnative_camera_xxx in the libs folders the loading step works fine but i still get a Fatal Signal 11. More details are in the logcat in log_native_camera.txt. Hope this will be helpfull - File log_native_camera.txt added Christophe E on 2013-11-22 10:32 - Status changed from Cancelled to Incomplete Alexander Smorkalov on 2013-11-22 12:41 As I can suppose from your logcat, crash takes place not in camera code, but in your code. Please try tutorial2 example to test native camera support. Run sample and switch in to native camera mode using menu. If it fails, attach its logcat here. Your failure stack from logcat:

- Status changed from Incomplete to Open Christophe E on 2013-11-25 08:48 Here is the logcat for sample "Native activity". The only changes made was to remove the use of opencv manager since it does not work anymore (or at least the last version 2.4.6.2)on Samsung Note III. - File log_native_activity.txt added Alexander Smorkalov on 2013-12-30 10:38 - Target version changed from 2.4.8 to 2.4.9 Javier S on 2014-01-28 15:16 I am also having issues with the native camera on the Galaxy Note 3. In case it helps, I have attached my logcat output. I'm using OpenCV 2.4.8. OpenCV Manager is up-to-date (2.4.8.0 rev 1) Kirill Kornyakov on 2014-02-17 19:45 Alexander, let's check it with the highest priority. - Priority changed from Normal to Blocker Alexander Smorkalov on 2014-03-24 17:07 - Pull request set to https://github.com/Itseez/opencv/pull/2501 - Status changed from Open to Done a dummy on 2014-04-27 01:10 My Note 3 has trouble running the native window example. It crashed after a bunch of camera stuff: ... 04-25 00:24:30.149: D/OpenCV_NativeCamera(14905): Supported Antibanding Options: off,60hz,50hz,auto 04-25 00:24:30.149: D/OpenCV_NativeCamera(14905): Supported Flash Modes: off,auto,on,torch 04-25 00:24:30.149: D/OpenCV_NativeCamera(14905): initCameraConnect: autofocus is set to mode "continuous-video" 04-25 00:24:30.149: D/OpenCV_NativeCamera(14905): initCameraConnect: preview format is set to yuv420sp 04-25 00:24:30.149: D/OpenCV_NativeCamera(14905): initCameraConnect: preview format is set to 640x480 04-25 00:24:30.149: A/libc(14905): Fatal signal 11 (SIGSEGV) at 0x00000000 (code=1), thread 14921 (.NativeActivity) I suppose this is the same problem? Philip Sibthorp on 2014-12-16 17:41 I also have the same problem on a brand new Samsung S5. My application works fine on a Samsung Tablet (GT-N8010) and Samsung S2 (GT-I9100.) I use OpenCV statically linked and have made sure the latest libnative_camera_rn.n.n.so files are installed. The OpenCV sample: native_activity also crashes in the same way. I have reported this as a bug but is anything going to be done about it? If not I will have wasted Â£525 on a Samsung S5! Please help. - Target version changed from 2.4.9 to 2.4.11 - Status changed from Done to Open Jo Nas on 2015-03-10 13:25 I have the same problem with OnePlus One (Android 4.4.4) and Galaxy S5 (Android 4.4.2). Please fix this as I cannot use opencv's native camera at all on Android. Vadim Pisarevsky on 2015-05-21 22:13 ok, native camera is important, but given the Google attitude to the support of this part (as I know, we use some internal headers from google tree in order to build this component), it's not much that we can do. patches are always appreciated though. - Priority changed from Blocker to Low
